question: In the 18th century, the capital of Russia was moved from Moscow to where?
api_result: In the 18th century, the capital of Russia was moved from Moscow to Saint Petersburg. This move was initiated by Tsar Peter the Great in 1712, following his founding of the city in 1703. Saint Petersburg remained the capital of Russia until 1918, when the government moved the capital back to Moscow after the Bolshevik Revolution.
